However, moves used by the target that inflict a stat reduction effect on themselves, or non-status moves that inflict stat reduction effects are not reflected.
Critical-Hit Defense: Prevents attacks on the target from being critical hits.
Unity Disruption: Makes it difficult for the target to fill their unity gauge.
Chain Reduction: Shortens the duration the target’s unity bonus is available.
No Switching: Prevents sync pairs from switching.
Move Gauge Acceleration: Causes the target’s move gauge to fill more quickly.
Weather Lock: If the weather has already been changed, prevents it from being changed again.
Tips_en.lsd.8:
A sync pair’s status can be changed temporarily during battle. Below is a list of status categories.
Confusion: Causes a Pokémon to potentially hit itself instead of an opponent when using a move. It lasts for a certain number of moves from the Pokémon, or until the sync pair is switched.
Flinching: Causes a Pokémon to flinch, making the Pokémon unable to perform a move. While flinching, the move gauge fills more slowly. It lasts for a certain amount of time, until using a sync move, or until the sync pair is switched. It will also end if the Pokémon is put to sleep or frozen.
Trapped: Prevents sync pairs from being switched and causes the target to take damage when taking an action. It lasts for a few moves from the Pokémon.
No Evasion: Causes moves on the target to always land (except in certain circumstances). Lasts for a fixed amount of time or until the sync pair is switched.
Type Resistance: Temporarily grants resistance to the specified move type. There are 18 types in total: Normal, Fire, Water, Electric, Grass, Ice, Fighting, Poison, Ground, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Rock, Ghost, Dragon, Dark, Steel, and Fairy. The damage the target takes from moves of the specified type is reduced. It lasts until the sync pair is switched.
Enduring: Allows the target to always have 1 HP remaining after being hit by a move that would otherwise reduce their HP to 0. However, it does not work against unity attacks or sync moves. It works once, or lasts until the sync pair is switched.
Continuous Healing: Recovers HP with every action performed by the Pokémon. It lasts for a certain number of Pokémon moves, or until the sync pair is switched.
Condition Nullification: Prevents some status changes and all status conditions inflicted by opponents. It lasts for a certain amount of time, or until the sync pair is switched.
Sure Hit Next: Causes the next move to always land, with some exceptions. It works until a move is performed, or until the sync pair is switched.
Critical Hit Next: Causes the next attack to always be a critical hit (except in certain circumstances). The attack itself may miss, however. It works until a move is performed, or until the sync pair is switched.
Tips_en.lsd.9: Custom Training Machines & Custom Super Training Machines
Tips_en.lsd.10: Some sync pairs require Custom Training Machines to learn moves and passive skills.
Tips_en.lsd.12: Some sync pairs require Custom ★ Power-Ups to increase their number of ★s.
Tips_en.lsd.14:
In some events, special area info can be unlocked by collecting a certain number of Custom Vouchers.
Custom Vouchers and Custom Super Vouchers can also be exchanged for special items in the shop during events.
They are not automatically converted into coins upon completion of an event, and will remain in your stock.
Tips_en.lsd.16: Some sync pairs require Custom Sync Move Upgrades to level up their sync moves.
Tips_en.lsd.17:
Battles can be affected by weather conditions.
Sunny Boosts Fire-type attacks. Freezing is disabled, and the frozen status condition is removed.
Rain Boosts Water-type attacks.
Hail All sync pairs in battle take damage with every action.
Sandstorm All sync pairs in battle take damage with every action.
The effect of some moves changes based on the weather. Some passive skills are only activated during certain weather conditions. When the weather has already been changed and another weather-altering effect is used, the previous weather condition is overwritten and its effects are removed.
Tips_en.lsd.18:
Sync pairs can be temporarily affected by status changes during battle. These effects are listed below.
Confused: The Pokémon can potentially hit itself instead of an opponent when using a move. It lasts until the Pokémon uses a certain number of moves or until the sync pair is switched out.
Flinching: Causes the Pokémon to flinch, making it unable to perform a move. While flinching, the move gauge fills more slowly. It lasts for a fixed amount of time, until the sync pair uses its sync move, or until it’s switched out. It will also end if the Pokémon is put to sleep or frozen.
Trapped: The affected sync pair can no longer be switched out, and the Pokémon takes damage after every action. It lasts until the Pokémon uses a certain number of moves.
No Evasion: Moves against the target always hit (except in certain circumstances). It lasts for a fixed amount of time or until the sync pair is switched out.
Type Resistance: Temporarily grants resistance to one of the following 18 move types: Normal, Fire, Water, Electric, Grass, Ice, Fighting, Poison, Ground, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Rock, Ghost, Dragon, Dark, Steel, or Fairy. The damage the target takes from moves of the specified type is reduced. It lasts until the sync pair is switched out.
Enduring: After being hit by a move that would otherwise cause them to faint, the Pokémon endures with 1 HP remaining. However, it does not work against Unity Attacks or sync moves. It works once or lasts until the sync pair is switched out.
Gradual Healing: HP gradually recovers with every action performed by the Pokémon. It works until the Pokémon uses a certain number of moves or until the sync pair is switched out.
Condition Nullification: Prevents some status effects and all status conditions inflicted by opponents. It lasts for a fixed amount of time or until the sync pair is switched out.
Sure Hit Next: The next move always hits (except in certain circumstances). It works until the Pokémon uses a move or until the sync pair is switched out.
Critical Hit Next: The next attack is always a critical hit (except in certain circumstances). The attack itself may miss, however. It works until the Pokémon uses a move or until the sync pair is switched out.
Tips_en.lsd.19:
The categories listed below can be found in the Exchange Items menu.
General: Items that can be exchanged at any time.
Event: Items that can only be exchanged during a specified time period.
Daily: Items that can be exchanged a specified number of times each day.
Monthly: Items that can be exchanged a specified number of times each month.
There may be instances where certain categories do not contain any exchangeable items.
Tips_en.lsd.20:
In co-op battles, the unity gauge fills up when sync pairs from your team continuously perform successful attack moves.
When the unity gauge is full, sync pairs from your team will automatically perform a powerful unity attack.
You can select which sync pairs will participate in the unity attack. The more supereffective sync pair types used, the more damage they do to opponents they are super effective against. In addition, the unity attack itself will change to a specific type if all sync pairs on the team are of the same type.
When three allied sync pairs from your team continuously attack without the opponent making a move, a unity bonus is activated for a certain period of time. While the unity bonus is in effect, the damage inflicted by attack moves from the sync pairs on your team increases, and the unity gauge will fill even if the attacks of your team’s sync pairs do not land.
Performing a supereffective attack while the unity bonus is in effect increases the duration of the bonus for any attacks that land.
Tips_en.lsd.21: When you acquire a duplicate sync pair, the level of its sync move increases. Sync moves have a maximum level of 5, and their damage and effectiveness increase with each rise in level.
Tips_en.lsd.22: Sync moves are attacks that can only be used when the sync move countdown reaches zero. The sync move countdown is reduced by one every time you perform a move.
Tips_en.lsd.23:
Effects on the field of play affect all sync pairs.
These effects can cover three areas: the allied side, the opposing side, and the entire field, thereby affecting any sync pairs in those respective areas. The following is a list of area effect types. (Some wear out after a period of time.)
Damage Reduction: Reduces damage received by the target. Some effects reduce damage taken from physical moves, and some effects reduce damage from special moves.
Status Move Defense: Prevents the target from being affected by an opponent’s status move.
Status Condition Defense: Prevents the target from being inflicted with a status condition. However, moves that inflict status conditions on yourself cannot be defended against.
Status Condition Reflection: Reflects the status condition of the target that has been inflicted by an opponent’s status move back to the opponent. However, moves used by the target that inflict a status condition on themselves, or non-status moves that inflict status conditions are not reflected.
Stat Reduction Defense: Prevents the target from having its stats reduced. However, moves that reduce your own stats cannot be defended against.
Stat Reduction Reflection: Reflects the stat reduction effect of a target that has been inflicted by an opponent’s status move back to the opponent. However, moves used by the target that inflict a stat reduction effect on themselves, or non-status moves that inflict stat reduction effects are not reflected.
Critical-Hit Defense: Prevents attacks on the target from being critical hits.
Unity Disruption: Makes it difficult for the target to fill their unity gauge.
Chain Reduction: Shortens the duration the target’s unity bonus is available.
No Switching: Prevents sync pairs from switching.
Move Gauge Acceleration: Causes the target’s move gauge to fill more quickly.
Weather Lock: If the weather has already been changed, prevents it from being changed again.
Tips_en.lsd.25:
Battles can be affected by the following weather conditions:
Sunny Boosts Fire-type attacks. Freezing is disabled, and the frozen status condition is removed.
Rain Boosts Water-type attacks.
Hail All sync pairs on the battlefield take damage with every action.
Sandstorm All sync pairs on the battlefield take damage with every action.
The effect of some moves changes based on the weather. Some passive skills are only activated during certain weather conditions. Weather conditions return to normal and all effects are removed as time elapses. If a weather-altering effect is used while another weather condition is active, the previous weather condition is overwritten by the new one and its effects are removed.
Tips_en.lsd.26:
There are two ways of matching in co-op play.
Quick Connect: Automatically matches you with other players in the matching lobby.
Connect with Friends: Invite and play with other players. Select Invite from Friend List to choose players to invite to the matching lobby. For invited players, the area info for the battle can be accessed by selecting the Invitations button at the bottom of the Poryphone menu.
You can also match up using a specified party number by selecting Party Number Search on the Invitations screen or on the matching method screen for your chosen battle.
Tips_en.lsd.28:
In Mission Bingo, you can earn rewards by completing missions on 3×3 bingo cards. Tap the Mission Bingo icon in the Pokémon Center to see what bingo cards are currently available.
Earn extra rewards on a Mission Bingo card by completing missions that form vertical, horizontal, or diagonal lines. Complete all the missions specified on the card’s squares to achieve a blackout and earn even more rewards.
There are three types of Mission Bingo.
Difficulty-based: Bingo cards come in three difficulties: beginner, intermediate, and advanced. Missions become harder as the difficulty increases.
Weekly: Bingo card contents change every week.
Event: Bingo cards are linked to events. Complete the entire card (blackout) to take on a new set of missions.
Note: weekly Mission Bingo cards and event Mission Bingo cards are only available for a limited period of time. Rewards must be claimed during the event period from the Mission Bingo screen. They cannot be claimed after this, even if missions on these bingo cards have been completed.
Tips_en.lsd.30:
Learn grid skills on the sync grid to strengthen your sync pairs. Sync orbs specific to each sync pair are required to learn grid skills.
Grid Skills: Grid skills vary by sync pair. Each grid skill (one tile on the sync grid) requires a set amount of energy to activate. To activate a tile and learn a grid skill, you must first activate an adjacent tile. Some tiles have additional unlock requirements. The benefits gained by learning grid skills are not reflected on a sync pair’s detail screen or in their move descriptions. Grid skills that include a specific move name in their skill description are only effective when performing that move.
Sync Orbs: At the start of a single-player battle, you may see a Sync orb chance! message on the screen. During these battles, you can obtain a sync pair-specific sync orb when you use a sync move for the first time. Co-op sync orbs can be obtained from co-op battles. These can be exchanged for sync pair-specific sync orbs using the Sync Grid menu. The sync grid feature will unlock upon completing main story Chapter 11: Alola’s Rising Stars! Part 2.
Sync Grid Reset: Resetting will revert the sync grid to its initial state, which deactivates all tiles and returns any energy that was used. This will allow you to learn different grid skills if you so choose. The benefits gained by learning grid skills will also be removed.
Tips_en.lsd.32: At the start of a single-player battle, you may see a Sync orb chance! message on the screen. During these battles, you can obtain a sync pair-specific sync orb when you use a sync move for the first time. The odds of a sync orb chance occurring decrease after every appearance. However, this probability resets after the date has changed. Sync orb chance probabilities differ between single-player battles and co-op battles.
Tips_en.lsd.33:
During battle, the move gauge fills up over time.
Moves that use the move gauge cannot be performed until the move gauge is sufficiently full. Different moves use up a different amount of the gauge.

In co-op battles, the move gauge goes down when a sync pair on your team faints and another switches in.
Tips_en.lsd.34:
You can create teams for both single-player and co-op battles. You choose three sync pairs to create your team.
In a single-player battle, you control all three sync pairs on your team, and you can toggle between them as needed.
In a co-op battle, you choose the three sync pairs who will take turns battling in the center position. You cannot control the other players’ sync pairs on the left or right during battle.
Also, you cannot have 2 or more sync pairs that include Trainers with the same name in your team.
Tips_en.lsd.35:
Sync pairs can be temporarily affected by several different conditions and effects during battle. These effects are listed below.
Confused: The Pokémon can potentially hit itself instead of an opponent when using a move. It lasts until the Pokémon uses a certain number of moves or until the sync pair is switched out.
Flinching: Causes the Pokémon to flinch, making it unable to perform a move. While flinching, the move gauge fills more slowly. It lasts for a fixed amount of time, until the sync pair uses its sync move, or until it’s switched out. It will also end if the Pokémon is put to sleep or frozen.
Trapped: The affected sync pair can no longer be switched out, and the Pokémon takes damage after every action. It lasts until the Pokémon uses a certain number of moves.
No Evasion: Moves against the target always hit (except in certain circumstances). It lasts for a fixed amount of time or until the sync pair is switched out.
Type Resistance: Temporarily grants resistance to one of the following 18 move types: Normal, Fire, Water, Electric, Grass, Ice, Fighting, Poison, Ground, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Rock, Ghost, Dragon, Dark, Steel, or Fairy. The damage the target takes from moves of the specified type is reduced. It lasts until the sync pair is switched out.
Enduring: After being hit by a move that would otherwise cause them to faint, the Pokémon endures with 1 HP remaining. However, being hit by a unity attack, a sync move, or certain other moves can nullify this effect. It works once or lasts until the sync pair is switched out.
Gradual Healing: HP gradually recovers with every action performed by the Pokémon. It works until the Pokémon uses a certain number of moves or until the sync pair is switched out.
Condition Nullification: Prevents all status conditions as well as certain other conditions inflicted by opponents. It lasts for a fixed amount of time or until the sync pair is switched out.
Sure Hit Next: The next move always hits (except in certain circumstances). It works until the Pokémon uses a move or until the sync pair is switched out.
Critical Hit Next: The next attack is always a critical hit (except in certain circumstances). The attack itself may miss, however. It works until the Pokémon uses a move or until the sync pair is switched out.

tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0701_0100_: Did you know that every sync pair has a type that it’s weak against? It’s a scientific fact!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0701_0200_: Before you depart on a journey or task, I highly recommend that you check the area’s weakness type and edit your team accordingly!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0702_0100_: Using attacks of that weakness type will inflict even greater damage than normal, you see!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2701_0702_0200_: They’re super effective! Remember to adjust for weaknesses. You won’t regret it! The results will speak for themselves.
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0701_0100_: Pssst! I’ve got a tip that’ll help you take down tough opponents! It’s about switching targets...
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0701_0200_: The more opponents you have battling against you at once, the harder it is to defeat them, right?
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0701_0300_: Well, if you target the weaker sync pairs first, you can take them off the board faster! Once you do that, winning is a breeze!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0702_0100_: Then again, sometimes it’s better to go for the strongest sync pair first, depending on the situation. Use your best judgment!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2704_0702_0200_: Either way, switching targets can be a superhelpful strategy!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0701_0100_: Oww! That s-stings... I was petting my friend’s Infernape, and I accidentally burned my hand...
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0701_0200_: Did you know that Pokémon can get burned, too? They can also be poisoned, paralyzed, frozen, and put to sleep.
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0702_0100_: We call these status conditions. Switching out your Pokémon isn’t enough to heal them, so be careful.
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2706_0702_0200_: Ow-ow-ow! Man, this burn really does hurt... If only it would heal automatically after a battle, like my Pokémon...
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0701_0100_: “After you use a sync move, the amount of damage your team inflicts will increase...”
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0701_0200_: Oops! Sorry...was I talking out loud? I’m trying to memorize everything I’ve learned about sync moves, but they’re so complicated!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0702_0100_: Apparently, the opposing team in a battle can use their own sync moves, too.
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2709_0702_0200_: Man, it’s tough memorizing all of this! It might be better to go out and do lots of battling to build up muscle memory instead!
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2710_0701_0100_: The abbreviation “PML” gets thrown around  quite a bit, doesn’t it? Do you remember what it stands for?
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2710_0701_0200_: It’s short for “Pokémon Masters League”— the tournament currently being held here on Pasio.
tutorial_general_talk_01_en.lsd.tutorial_general_talk_01/2710_0702_0100_: “P” for “Pokémon,” “M” for “Masters,” and “L” for “League!” See? It’s quite simple to remember!

tutorial_quest_01_en.lsd.tutorial_quest_01/0601_0701_0100_10: Hey! Brock and Misty were telling me about you. It looks like you’re getting the hang of Pokémon battles!
tutorial_quest_01_en.lsd.tutorial_quest_01/0601_0701_0200_10: I’ll teach you more advanced techniques. You’d better not blow me off!
tutorial_quest_01_en.lsd.tutorial_quest_01/0602_0702_0100_10: Hey, not too shabby! But then again, I’m the one teaching you, so it’s only natural!
tutorial_quest_01_en.lsd.tutorial_quest_01/0602_0702_0200_10: Maybe you can become as good as me someday! Don’t let that get to your head. You gotta keep training for that to happen!

The offering rate applies to each instance of sync pair scouting, so there is no guarantee that you will get any one sync pair, even if you scout many times in a row.  You may get sync pairs that you have already acquired when you scout.  When you are scouting, you will see sync pairs with unevolved Pokémon even if you have previously acquired and evolved them.  When you see a * displayed after a Pokémon name in the offering rate, that means that sync pair can evolve their Pokémon through an Evolution sync pair story.
shop_en.lsd.shop/scout_043: The offering rate for each ★ is rounded off past the fourth decimal, so adding them all up may not equal 100%. We do not round the actual offering rate up or down. title_en.lsd.title/title_103: 수집항목: 생년월일, 거주국·지역, 이용언어, 유저명, 유저가 게임 내에 기술한 정보(문의내용, 앙케이트 내용), 유저 ID, 게임 데이터, 게임 로그 데이터, 크래시 로그 데이터, IP 주소, cookie 정보, 어플리케이션 버전, OS 버전, OS 타입, 네트워크 타입, 타임존, 단말명, 휴대폰단말의 캐리어 정보, 이용자의 휴대폰단말의 언어 설정 정보 및 타게팅 광고의 제한에 관한 설정 상태, 이용자에 의한 닌텐도 어카운트 연계 허가 시에는 닌텐도 어카운트 ID 및 닌텐도 어카운트에서 설정된 정보(국가/지역, 언어, 타임존, 성별) 수집·이용목적: 이용규약에 대한 동의의 요구, 부정이용자의 확인 및 부정이용자에 대한 각종 대응, 분석 및 오류 조사 대응, 유저 대응  <attr size='22' height='26'>보유·이용기간: 게임 서비스 제공 기간 동안 및 게임 서비스 제공 종료 후 10년간 </attr>  <attr color='EB1414'>※상기 개인정보의 수집·이용을 거부하는 경우, 본 어플리케이션을 이용할 수 없습니다. </attr>
title_en.lsd.title/title_104: 【2】광고성 정보를 전송할 목적의 개인정보의 수집·이용에 대한 동의(선택)
title_en.lsd.title/title_105: 고객의 본 어플리케이션에서의 이용정보를 고객에 맞춘 알림 등의 광고·정보를 전송하기 위해 이용합니다. 수집 항목: 생년월일, 거주국·지역, 이용언어, 유저ID, 게임 데이터,게임 로그 데이터, IP 주소, 인스톨 전에 액세스했던 사이트에 관한 정보, 어플리케이션의 버전, OS 버전, OS 타입, 타게팅 광고의 제한에 관한 설정 상태, 단말광고식별자, 네트워크 타입, 타임존  <attr size='22' height='26'>수집·이용목적: 고객에 맞춘 알림 등의 광고· 정보의 전송 보유·이용기간:  동의일부터 게임 서비스 제공 기간 동안 및 게임 서비스 종료 후 10년간</attr>  <attr color='EB1414'>※상기 개인정보의 수집·이용을 거부한 경우에도 본 어플리케이션을 이용하실 수 있습니다. </attr>
title_en.lsd.title/title_106: 【3】툴 제공자에 의한 이용정보 수집 및 국외이전에 대한 동의(선택)
title_en.lsd.title/title_107: ①툴 제공자에 의한 이용정보수집에 대한 동의 광고 전송을 위해 고객의 본 어플리케이션의 이용정보를 이하의 툴 제공자가 수집합니다.  <attr size='22' height='26'>수집원, 개인정보의 이용목적, 수집하는 개인정보의 항목에 대해서는 이하에 기재되어 있습니다. </attr>  수집하는 자: adjust Inc.  <attr size='22' height='26'>수집하는 개인정보의 이용목적: 광고성 정보의 전송 및 송신에 활용</attr>  수집하는 개인정보의 항목: MAC 주소, 단말정보(단말ID, 국가 정보, 우편번호, 인터넷 서비스 프로바이더 정보), 모바일 네트워크 코드 및 본 어플리케이션 이용 고객에 관한 어플리케이션의 기동 정보 및 과금 정보 등의 이용 이력  <attr size='22' height='26'>수집하는 개인정보의 보유 및 이용기간: 고객으로부터 삭제 의뢰를 받을 때까지</attr>  ②툴 제공자에 의한 이용정보수집에 따른 국외이전에 대한 동의 광고 전송을 위해 고객의 본 어플리케이션의 이용정보를 이하의 툴 제공자가 수집함에 따라 아래와 같이 해당 정보가 국외로 이전됩니다. 이전을 받는 자의 성명: adjust Inc. 국가: 미합중국 <attr color='8a40c3'>독일연방공화국 네덜란드</attr> 정보관리책임자의 연락처: privacy＠adjust.com 이전일: 고객에 의한 본 어플리케이션의 이용 시 이전 방법: 네트워크를 통한 전송  <attr size='22' height='26'>이전을 받는 자의 이용목적: 광고성 정보의 전송 및 송신에 활용 이전을 받는 자의 보유 및 이용기간: 고객으로부터 삭제 의뢰를 받을 때까지</attr>  이전되는 개인정보 항목: MAC 주소, 단말정보(단말ID, 단말국 정보, 우편번호, 인터넷 서비스 프로바이더 정보), 모바일 넷트워크 코드 및 어플리케이션 이용 고객에 관한 어플리케이션의 기동 정보 및 이용 이력  <attr color='EB1414'>※상기 개인정보의 수집·국외이전을 거부한 경우에도 본 어플리케이션을 이용하실 수 있습니다. </attr>
title_en.lsd.title/title_109: ＜개인정보의 수집·이용에 대한 동의(필수)＞를 거부하는 경우, 본 어플리케이션을 이용할 수 없습니다.

title_en.lsd.title/review_002: Thank you for playing [Name:TitleName ]!  Are you enjoying your time on Pasio?
title_en.lsd.title/review_004: Let us know what we can do to improve your gaming experience. We’d love to hear your feedback!
title_en.lsd.title/review_005: Glad you’re having fun!  If you have a moment to leave a review, we’d love to hear your feedback!
title_en.lsd.title/push_002: Adventure is waiting for you on Pasio. Log in now!

tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_swipe_002: You can explore the Pokémon Center by swiping left or right on the screen.  There are always a handful of Trainers around the lobby to talk to and get to know better!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_taptalk_002: Feel like striking up a conversation? Try tapping the Trainers with a small icon above their head to have a chat!  Who knows? They might challenge you to a Pokémon battle or even give you some useful items!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_fieldgo_002: If you’d like to continue to the next area, tap the blue arrow near the bottom of the screen.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_common_101: Now it’s your turn. Good luck!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_waza_100: Typical battles on Pasio are fought in teams of 3-on-3, and you control each of your three teammates!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_waza_101: First, try attacking with Pikachu’s Thunder Shock!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_waza_111: Using moves depletes your move gauge!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_waza_112: Your move gauge fills up over time!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_waza_121: Tap on Brock’s window to use one of Onix’s moves!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_101: Every sync pair has a type that it’s weak against.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_111: Attack with moves that match its weakness type to inflict double the damage!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_121: Try switching targets to a Pokémon that’s weak against your attacks!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_211: Tap a Pokémon on the opposite team to target it!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_221: The border around this window will flash if you have a move that’s super effective against the target!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_241: Next, try using Brock’s Onix to target one of your opponents’ weaknesses!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_251: Switch between your teammates to use the most effective moves!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_buddies_111: Sync moves are powerful attacks capable of doing massive damage to your opponents.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_buddies_138: Every time you use a move, your sync move countdown goes down.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_buddies_141: That goes for all three teammates! Every move reduces the countdown!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_buddies_151: Countdown complete! Tap the icon to unleash a powerful sync move!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_buddies_211: Select which sync pair you’d like to use!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_passive_101: Some opponents have special passive skills!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_passive_111: This sync pair has a passive skill called Clearheaded—it prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_101: Let’s learn a little about multiteam battling before we jump into co-op with other players!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_111: The Pokémon you see on Pikachu’s left and right belong to the other players’ teams.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_121: Your team is always in the center position. The active sync pair here is the only one you control.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_131: The sync pair you place in your team’s #1 position will always be the first on the field.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_141: The left and right windows are the other two sync pairs on your team. Right now, they’re on standby.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_151: During a battle, you may need to switch your active sync pair with one that’s on standby!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_172: You can tap Onix to switch him in or tap one of his moves to use it right away once he’s on the field.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_173: Tap this move to switch in and use it immediately!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_change_201: Try attacking with your active sync pair!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_101: Let’s try syncing up with the other players for a unity attack!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_111: To use a unity attack, you need to  fill up your unity gauge.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_131: Fill up your unity gauge by building up a continuous chain of attacks with your allies!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_141: Success! You and your allies built up a chain of continuous attacks without being interrupted by the other team!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_151: The more chains you create, the faster your unity gauge fills up!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_161: Try building up a chain of attacks!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_171: Creating a chain with all three allies activates a unity bonus! While in effect, your attack power increases!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_173: On top of that, EVERY attack fills up your unity gauge, whether or not you create another chain!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_181: Make sure you use as many attacks as possible before the effects of your unity bonus wear off!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_191: Continue attacking while unity bonus is in effect!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_211: You filled your unity gauge to max! Get ready to unleash a powerful unity attack with your allies!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_issei_221: Choose which sync pair to use for the attack before the timer runs out!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_cattack_111: Tap the sync pair you wish to switch out!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_cattack_121: You can tap on a move to use it immediately after switching in!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_wazatokkun_001_10: Let’s try learning a new move! Go to the Team menu and select Moves & Skills.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_wazatokkun_002_10: First, confirm that you have the required items here.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_wazatokkun_003_10: Once a move is learned, it’s ready to be used in battle! Try learning some moves with your favorite sync pairs!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_001_11: At the shop, you can scout for new teammates, exchange your items, and acquire all sorts of useful things!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_001_12: First, let’s use Sync Pair Scout to reach out to some new teammates!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_002_11: You found a new teammate! Scout again to reach out to more Trainers and build your dream team!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_003_11: Collect your bonus level-up manual by visiting your Present Box!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_itemexchange_001_10: Use this screen to exchange your coins and items for various things you might need.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_levelup_001_11: You can use level-up manuals to help your sync pairs gain experience and level up!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_charaepisode_001_11: Choose a sync pair story to go on an adventure and get to know your fellow teammates!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multi_001_11: Tap this button to edit your teams for co-op battling.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_11: Currently, this is as far as the story goes.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_12: Please look forward to further updates in the near future!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyhard_001_11: Pokémon Masters League hard mode unlocked!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyhard_001_12: You now have access to area info with even more challenging battles!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyveryhard_001_11: Pokémon Masters League very hard mode unlocked!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyveryhard_001_12: You now have access to area info with even more challenging battles!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multihard_001_11: You now have access to EX Challenges in the training area!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_favoritebaddies_001_11: You can choose a favorite sync pair to appear with you on your profile screen.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hoshiup_001_11: You can use ★ Power-Ups to increase a sync pair’s number of ★s and help them grow stronger!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_event_mission_001_11: You now have access to the events area! Let’s check out what events are going on right now!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_event_mission_001_12: Ongoing events will appear in the Events category. Check often to avoid missing special limited-time area info!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_extraarea_001_12: Visit the training area to collect items that will help you learn moves and passive skills, level up, and more!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_extraarea_001_13: When you receive area info for learning new battle techniques, that will appear here as well.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_genkaitoppa_001_11: You now have access to the Unlock Level Cap menu!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_genkaitoppa_001_21: Unlocking a sync pair’s level cap means that they can raise their level even higher and grow even stronger!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_002_11: Visit the training area to collect the special items required for unlocking the level caps on your sync pairs!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_004_11: You can access this area info in the Special Training: Battle Techniques sub-section of the training area!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_004_12: Complete this area to make sync pair level caps unlockable!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_005_10: Let’s try unlocking our current level cap with some Buff Blend. Go to the Team menu and select Unlock Level Cap.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_006_10: First, confirm that you have the required items here.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_007_10: Nice! The max level you can achieve is now even higher. Next, try unlocking the level caps of your other favorite sync pairs.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_kasane_001_11: When you scout out a sync pair that you already have, their sync move levels up!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_kasane_001_21: Once a sync move reaches its level 5 max, you’ll receive a ★ Power-Up with the same number of ★s as the duplicate sync pair instead!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_10: Let’s try editing your team with the new sync pair you just scouted!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_11: First, select the sync pair you wish to switch out.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_12: Next, select the sync pair you wish to switch in!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_13: The sync pair you selected is now a part of your team!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_14: Give yourself an advantage by editing your team based on the type of battling you’ll be doing next!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shinka_001_11: For some sync pairs, leveling up can unlock special area info for evolving Pokémon! However, Evolution shards and Evolution crystals are required.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shinka_001_21: Complete this special sync pair story to evolve your Pokémon and make this sync pair even stronger!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_001_11: Rosa’s Pokémon uses Grass-type moves, so having her on your team will give you an advantage!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_001_12: Tap this button to edit your team now, or go to the Team menu to edit your team later!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_002_11: Barry’s Pokémon uses Water-type moves, so having him on your team will give you an advantage!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_003_11: Flannery’s Pokémon uses Fire-type moves, so having her on your team will give you an advantage!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_12: You now have access to co-op battles where you can fight alongside other players!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_13: Let’s give co-op battling a try now!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_14: During this tutorial, you’ll be battling alongside NPCs for practice!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_15: Try syncing up with your allies to create attack chains and unleash a unity attack!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_16: Now you’re ready for some multiteam battling!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_17: Choose an area to explore under the Co-op tab to join other players in multiteam battles!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_18: To continue the main story, choose an area to explore under the Single-Player tab.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_event_mission_001_22: You now have access to the Missions menu on your Poryphone. Don’t forget to claim your rewards whenever you complete a mission!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_tansaku_001_11: You unlocked a new kind of area where you can explore Pasio and mingle with other Pokémon Trainers.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_tansaku_001_12: These special areas won’t affect your progression in the main story, so you can explore whenever you like!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_001_11: Your team can now use gear!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_001_12: You can equip your team with gear to make them even stronger!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_003_10: Let’s try equipping a 1★ Electric Bracelet. Go to the Team menu, and select Edit Team.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_004_10: You equipped a 1★ Electric Bracelet! Next, try equipping your teams with some other awesome gear.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_005_10: Equipping gear is especially effective when the gear’s type matches your sync pairs’ types.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_006_11: In the Upgrade Gear section of the Team menu, you can use duplicate gear along with special items to make your gear even better.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_006_12: Completing co-op battles on Very Hard is a good way to collect gear and gear-related items.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_007_11: Unwanted gear can be exchanged for coins using the Exchange Gear section of the shop.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_levelup_001_11: You can use various items to upgrade and enhance your gear!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_levelup_001_12: Any duplicate gear you obtain can be used to unlock level caps and upgrade your gear even further!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_soubi_sale_001_10: Use this screen to get rid of gear you no longer need and exchange it for coins.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_koutaiattack_001_11: Use this area info to participate in Special Training: Battle Techniques over in the training area!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_koutaiattack_002_11: Switch-in moves unlocked! In co-op battles, you can now tap a standby sync pair’s move to have them switch in and use it right away.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shinka_002_11: In order to participate in sync pair stories about Pokémon Evolution, you’ll need some Evolution materials.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shinka_002_21: You can exchange certain items for Evolution materials in the shop!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_iwakudaki_001_11: When you need to smash rocks in the field, Brock and Onix can lend you their strength. If a rock looks smashable, tap it and see what happens!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_hidenwaza_001_10: This rock looks breakable! Do you want Brock and Onix to smash it?
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_shinka_003_11: After reaching a certain level, some sync pairs unlock special Evolution area info! To visit these areas, you’ll need to collect either Evolution shards or Evolution crystals.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_001_11: Complete event areas to collect Custom Vouchers!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_001_12: Custom Voucher 1:  Collect a total of 800 of these to unlock special area info and team up with Giovanni & Mewtwo!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_001_13: In the Exchange Items menu, you can exchange Custom Vouchers for other custom items that will make Giovanni & Mewtwo even stronger!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_event_news001_01: Tap here to learn more about the event.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_13: Currently, this is as far as the story goes. Try tapping the Co-op tab on the Explore menu to challenge Trainers from the main story along with friends and other players!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_001_01: You now have access to the Battle Villa! See how far you and your roster of sync pairs can go before the time runs out in this all-new, endurance-based challenge!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_001_02: Open the Explore menu to check it out now!  To learn more about the Battle Villa, tap the information button at the top right of the screen.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_002_02: Visit the Moves & Skills menu to expand your sync pairs’ repertoire with all-new lucky skills!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_002_03: The Lucky Cookies and other special items you’ll need to learn these skills can be acquired in the Battle Villa.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_multi_text_001: You now have access to co-op areas in the Battle Villa! Tap the Co-op tab to see the areas you’ve unlocked so far.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_multi_text_002: Once unlocked, these areas never expire, so you can try your hand at them anytime! Just be careful— they aren’t easy!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_multi_text_003: Battle hard! The more halls you complete in the Battle Villa, the more co-op areas you’ll unlock.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_clear_text_001: You completed the final hall! We hope to see you again for the next Battle Villa challenge!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_clear_text_002: Until then, try your hand at a few co-op battles to stock up on Lucky Cookies.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_recovery_text_00: Tap here to use Battle Villa vitality treats.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_villa_battleitem_text_: Tap here to use Battle Villa vigor treats.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_002_12: Custom Voucher 2: Collect a total of 100 of these to unlock special area info and have the chance to team up with Solgaleo.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_002_13: In the Exchange Items menu, you can exchange Custom Vouchers for other custom items that will make your Solgaleo sync pair even stronger.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_003_12: Custom Voucher 3: Collect a total of 100 of these to unlock special area info and have the chance to team up with Zinnia & Rayquaza.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_003_13: In the Exchange Items menu, you can exchange Custom Vouchers for other custom items that will make Zinnia & Rayquaza even stronger.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_01: Professor Oak & Mew can be strengthened by using custom items.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_02: You can obtain custom items by completing Professor Oak & Mew special missions!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_03: Complete limited-time missions to strengthen Professor Oak & Mew before time runs out!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_04: You must complete Chapter 4 of the main story to participate in event missions.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_002_11: You can now strengthen your favorite sync pairs in a variety of new ways using the sync grid. Collect sync orbs to activate tiles and help your teammates grow!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_003_11: When you use a sync move in a single-player battle that displays the Sync orb chance! message, you’ll have a chance to get a sync orb that is unique to the attacking sync pair on your team.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_004_11: In co-op battles, you’ll have a chance to acquire co-op sync orbs instead. These can be exchanged in the shop for sync pair-specific sync orbs.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_005_11: In co-op battles, you’ll have a chance to acquire co-op sync orbs instead. You can trade these in for sync orbs that are specific to a sync pair by tapping the Exchange button.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_001_11: Use sync orbs to activate tiles and strengthen your sync pairs in all sorts of new ways!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_002_11: Activating a tile on the sync grid activates that grid skill for the  corresponding sync pair.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_003_11: Each tile requires a certain number of unique sync orbs to be activated. However, some tiles have additional requirements that must be met.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_004_11: To learn more, tap the information button at the top right of the sync grid screen.
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_event_bingo_mission_00: Tap the bingo card icon to open the Mission Bingo screen. Don’t forget to claim your rewards once you start filling up your card!
tutorial_en.lsd.tutorial/tutorial_new_epievent_001_11: Use travel tokens to explore the map and head toward the checkpoints!

zone_en.lsd.zone/dialog_001: Are you sure you want to receive additional completion rewards, chosen at random?
zone_en.lsd.zone/dialog_002: Are you sure you want to receive treats that can only be used in the Battle Villa?
zone_en.lsd.zone/dialog_alert_001: Note: Battle Villa treats don’t carry over. They’re deleted automatically at the end of each challenge period.
zone_en.lsd.zone/title_002: Select a type of bonus reward!
zone_en.lsd.zone/cell_description_001: Receive additional completion rewards, chosen at random.
zone_en.lsd.zone/cell_description_002: Receive Battle Villa treats that recover sync pair HP and MP.
zone_en.lsd.zone/cell_description_003: Receive Battle Villa treats that are useful in battles.
